news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says 'we have the makings of a deal' with China
news.summary: No description available. No description available for this model. For more information on this model, please visit: www.cruiseworld.com/cruisemodel.

news.title: Trump's trade agenda is on the line as appeals court hears arguments in key tariffs case
news.summary: Trump's reciprocal tariffs and trafficking-related duties were preivously struck down by a federal trade court, but that decision was put on pause.

news.title: CVS shares pop on earnings beat and outlook, as retail pharmacy and insurance units improve
news.summary: CVS CEO David Joyner pointed to strength in its retail pharmacy and improvement in its insurance unit, Aetna. CVS is grappling with higher medical costs.

news.title: Shares of world's largest brewer AB InBev tumble 9% on declining volumes
news.summary: Budweiser volumes declined 1.9% year-on-year over the three month period. This was well ahead of the 0.3% dip forecast by analysts.

news.title: Moderna to slash 10% of workforce as biotech cuts costs, Covid shot sales slow
news.summary: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel said the company expects to have fewer than 5,000 workers by the end of the year. In a memo to employees, he said the firm expects to be profitable by the year's end.

news.title: Meta’s growth strikes Wall Street as incomprehensibly strong, and the stock rockets
news.summary: If Meta's core business continues growing at the current rate and its Superintelligence efforts gain traction, “there’s no telling what the ceiling is for Meta,” analysts say.

news.title: More than 800 Moderna employees will lose their jobs this year as costs are slashed
news.summary: Moderna announced a large layoff the day before the vaccine maker was set to release second-quarter results. Moderna is a vaccine maker.

news.title: Mastercard earnings show robust spending — and send an upbeat message for Visa investors
news.summary: Mastercard boosted its guidance for the year, suggesting to one analyst that Visa’s forecast is “overly conservative.”

news.title: The meme-stock party is already fizzling out. What that means for the rest of the market.
news.summary: The meme-stock craze may have ended before it could flourish, caught up in a summer market and big tech earnings, says Vanda Research.

news.title: Jobless claims stay low as companies remain hesitant about layoffs
news.summary: The data indicate a stable labor market with low layoff activity. The data indicate that the labor market is stable and low lay off activity.
